metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS The object-fit Property
The CSS object-fit property is used to specify how an or
content.html: The CSS object-fit property is used to specify how an <img> or <video> should be resized to fit its container.

content.text: The CSS object-fit Property
The CSS object-fit property is used to specify how an or
content.html: The CSS object-fit property is used to specify how an <img> or <video> should be resized to fit its container.

content.text: This property tells the content to fill the container in a variety of ways; such as "preserve that aspect ratio" or "stretch up and take up as much space as possible".
content.html: This property tells the content to fill the container in a variety of ways; such as "preserve that aspect ratio" or "stretch up and take up as much space as possible".

content.text: Look at the following image from Paris. This image is 400 pixels wide and 300 pixels high:
content.html: Look at the following image from Paris. This image is 400 pixels wide and 300 pixels high:

content.text: However, if we style the image above to be half its width (200 pixels) and same height (300 pixels), it will look like this:
content.html: However, if we style the image above to be half its width (200 pixels) and same height (300 pixels), it will look like this:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
}

content.text: We see that the image is being squished to fit the container of 200x300 pixels (its original aspect ratio is destroyed).
content.html: We see that the image is being squished to fit the container of 200x300 pixels (its original aspect ratio is destroyed).

content.text: Here is where the object-fit property comes in. The object-fit property can take one of the following values:
content.html: Here is where the object-fit property comes in. The object-fit property can take one of the following values:

content.text: Using object-fit: cover;
If we use object-fit: cover; the image keeps its aspect ratio and fills the given dimension. The image will be clipped to fit:
content.html: If we use object-fit: cover; the image keeps its aspect ratio and fills the given dimension. The image will be clipped to fit:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
  object-fit: cover;
}

content.text: Using object-fit: contain;
If we use object-fit: contain; the image keeps its aspect ratio, but is resized to fit within the given dimension:
content.html: If we use object-fit: contain; the image keeps its aspect ratio, but is resized to fit within the given dimension:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
  object-fit: contain;
}

content.text: Using object-fit: fill;
If we use object-fit: fill; the image is resized to fill the given dimension. If necessary, the image will be stretched or squished to fit:
content.html: If we use object-fit: fill; the image is resized to fill the given dimension. If necessary, the image will be stretched or squished to fit:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
  object-fit: fill;
}

content.text: Using object-fit: none;
If we use object-fit: none; the image is not resized:
content.html: If we use object-fit: none; the image is not resized:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
  object-fit: none;
}

content.text: Using object-fit: scale-down;
If we use object-fit: scale-down; the image is scaled down to the smallest version of none or contain :
content.html: If we use object-fit: scale-down; the image is scaled down to the smallest version of none or contain:

content.code_html:
img {
  width: 200px;
  height: 300px;
  object-fit: scale-down;
}

content.text: Another Example
Here we have two images and we want them to fill the width of 50% of the browser window and 100% of the height.
content.html: Here we have two images and we want them to fill the width of 50% of the browser window and 100% of the height.

content.text: In the following example we do NOT use object-fit , so when we resize the browser window, the aspect ratio of the images will be destroyed:
content.html: In the following example we do NOT use object-fit, so when we resize the browser window, the aspect ratio of the images will be destroyed:

content.text: In the next example, we use object-fit: cover; , so when we resize the browser window, the aspect ratio of the images is preserved:
content.html: In the next example, we use object-fit: cover;, so when we resize the browser window, the aspect ratio of the images is preserved:

content.text: CSS object-fit More Examples
The following example demonstrates all the possible values of the object-fit property in one example:
content.html: The following example demonstrates all the possible values of the object-fit property in one example:

content.code_html:
.fill {object-fit: fill;}
.contain {object-fit: contain;}
.cover {object-fit: cover;}
.scale-down {object-fit: scale-down;}
.none {object-fit: none;}

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the purpose of the CSS object-fit property?
content.html: What is the purpose of the CSS object-fit property?

metadata.question: What is the purpose of the CSS object-fit property?

options.text: To add a shadow effect to an element.
To crop an image to a circle.
To resize an image or video to fit its container.
To apply a filter effect to an image.

content.question: What is the purpose of the CSS object-fit property?

options.text: To add a shadow effect to an element.
To crop an image to a circle.
To resize an image or video to fit its container.
To apply a filter effect to an image.

content.text: CSS Object-* Properties
The following table lists the CSS object-* properties:
content.html: The following table lists the CSS object-* properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
object-fit Specifies how an <img> or <video> should be resized to fit its container
object-position Specifies how an <img> or <video> should be positioned with x/y coordinates inside its "own content box"
